item.title: Rubbish dumped on Badgemore Path, 12th July
item.description:
Yet again, rubbish dumped beside litter bin. The entire Path is filthy and covered in rubbish, because it is not cleaned in the regular stret-cleaning schedule. Why?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ancona Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Low hanging branches, 12th July
item.description:
The tree is overgrown and is obstructing the pavement meaning you have to duck to walk under the tree. Some of the branches are dangerously swinging in the wind and could cause damage to parked cars and pedestrians passing by
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyndhurst Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Tha pathways always are full with rubbish, 12th July
item.description:
Only through fines will they learn to stop throwing garbage in the street. It is not safe to walk with a child because who knows what sharp glass could cut his hand or leg. Please warn you that you must come up with a solution as quickly as possible. Kind regards. Dumitru.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Nw1 1tt, 12th July
item.description:
Subject: Urgent: Missing Cyclist Lane Sign ‚Äì Crowndale Road, NW1 To whom it may concern, I am writing to formally report a missing cyclist lane sign. üìç Location: 26 Crowndale Road, London NW1 1TT ‚Äì next to Theatro Technis, between King's Cross and Camden üóì Date Sunday, 16 June 2025 Type of Sign Missing: Yellow cyclist lane warning sign On the evening of 16 June, I was riding my motorbike along Crowndale Road where there had recently been road renovation works. I believe a cyclist lane sign had previously been broken and was not replaced after the renovation. The road layout in that section is confusing without visible signage ‚Äî especially at night. The absence of the cyclist warning sign and any other clear markings created a hazardous condition. I am requesting the following from the council: Immediate inspection of the site and reinstatement of missing cyclist lane signage. Confirmation of when the roadworks were completed and whether signage was reviewed afterward. Maintenance and inspection records for that location, including any previous reports of the broken sign. Contact details of the highways contractor or department responsible for signage following the renovation. Please confirm receipt of this report and provide a written response regarding the status of the signage and any ongoing safety assessment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crowndale Road, Somers Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree trynk growth affecting road safety, 11th July
item.description:

item.title: Leak, 11th July
item.description:
